project_abstract.cdata: The Emergency Demobilization and Reintegration Project aims to a) provide sound post-conflict reintegration options to ex-combatants who have joined the ranks of the unemployed after the signing of the cease-fire agreement; b) help rehabilitate physical and social infrastructure; and c) support macroeconomic stability. The Bank's involvement will address the immediate post-conflict needs of the country; and provide the development leadership needed for reengagement of the international community in a country in the delicate and troubled Central Africa region. Building on ongoing Disarmament, Demobilization and Reintegration (DDR) activities in the country, this project will also help formulate a comprehensive Demobilization and Reintegration Program (DDR) in Congo by setting up necessary framework to build on donors' support for the DDR program. The project will contribute to ongoing efforts to consolidate peace and strengthen security in the Republic of Congo, while offering sound reintegration options to ex-combatants who joined the ranks of the unemployed after the signing of the cease-fire agreement. The credit will complement support provided by other donors and the Bank's ongoing Post-conflict Grant for the Reintegration of Women and Youth.
